docs.snippet: Advances in flat-screen technology have made older monitors and televisions obsolete, decimating demand for tube glass used in them and creating vast stockpiles of useless material....
docs.lead_paragraph: Advances in flat-screen technology have made older monitors and televisions obsolete, decimating demand for tube glass used in them and creating vast stockpiles of useless material.
docs.abstract: Advances in flat-screen technology have made older monitors and televisions obsolete, decimating demand for recycled tube glass used in them and creating vast stockpiles of useless material across country; bulk of waste is being stored, sent to landfills or smelters, or disposed of in other ways that experts say are environmentally destructive; in some cases, owners of such recycling centers have abandoned them.

headline.seo: Disposal of Older Monitors Leaves a Hazardous Trail
headline.main: Unwanted Electronic Gear Rising in Toxic Piles
headline.print_headline: Unwanted Electronic Gear Rising in Toxic Piles
